page.title: 19GURNARD PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: Gurnard was granted Parish Council status by the County Council in 1985, and monthly meetings are held at the Methodist Hall, Worsley Road. In the first Parish meeting topics raised included, cyclists on the sea wall, horse riders on a footpath, dog fouling, road signs, beach cleaning and flower beds. Concern was expressed about fouling of grass verges by dogs, and there was some doubt as to whether by-laws relating to pavements applied also to grass verges. A suggestion was made that the erection of chains and posts would prevent cyclists using the sea wall, but it was pointed out that this would also create a barrier for people pushing prams.Members also considered the position regarding the footpath between Shore Road and Worsley Road being used by people on horseback.
